video:video.video:title: Wix team: The most used piece of software at Microsoft (and it's open source!)
video:video.video:description: What piece of software is used in Windows, Office, MySQL, and many other places? The Windows Installer XML (WiX) toolset. But even better, did you know it's open source? And, did you know that it is&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Jeff Barr - Amazon Web Services Contest Winners
video:video.video:description: Jeff Barr, Web Services Evangelist at Amazon, dropped by my office the other day and showed me the winners of the Microsoft/Amazon Web Service Contest. Cool stuff, congrats! More details are up on th&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Jim Carroll, Dan Manrique - Two dev's story of helping Katrina victims
video:video.video:description: Jim and Dan are two seemingly normal Microsoft employees who I've been watching from afar (they work for Microsoft Consulting Services). When hurricane Katrina hit they dropped everything in their li&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Charlie Owen - Your first Media Center/Vista application (and a look at their secret room)
video:video.video:description: Over in building 50 there's a secret room. It's never been shown in public before. What is this room for? Testing audio devices. It is a special room where it's completely silent and the walls have be&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Richard Anderson - Interactive teaching with Tablet PCs at University of Washington
video:video.video:description: Recently I visited Richard Anderson's classroom at the University of Washington and watched how he used Tablet PCs to teach his computer science class. It is really cool. Students can send him notes, &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Ric Merrifield - Microsoft gets down to business with Motion initiative
video:video.video:description: Ric, director of strategy on the top secret Motion Incubation team, runs the Motion initiative. What's that? It's a group at Microsoft that studies how businesses work and looks for opportunities to h&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Mike Hall - Network Enabled Refrigeration Device (and pranks at Microsoft)
video:video.video:description: April 1, 2006 -- Mike Hall uses Windows CE for everything. Including building a network enabled refrigeration device (NERD) with the NERD feature pack, released today.While you're watching that vide&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Mike Arcuri - More business intelligence in Office 2007
video:video.video:description: This is a second, deeper look at Excel 2007's business intelligence capabilities (Mike Arcuri was on Channel 9 a few weeks ago). Really cool stuff for helping your business see what is happening. The&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Developer Solutions Team - Demos of MSBee, Managed Stack Explorer, and TFS Administration Tool
video:video.video:description: The Developer Solutions team invited Ken Levy over to check out their first 3 power toys for Visual Studio 2005. In this video, youâ€™ll meet the team and catch demos of MSBee, Managed Stack Explorer, &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Satya Nadella - Running the Dynamics Team
video:video.video:description: We continue our tour of the Dynamics team today with a few interviews. Here you meet Satya Nadella, who is the corporate vice president of the Dynamics team. Executive alert! But, he's pretty cool&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Mike Ehrenberg - Architecting next generation of Dynamics
video:video.video:description: It's Dynamics Day on Channel 9. Here's Mike Ehrenberg, architect on the Dynamics team talking about what he's working on.

video:video.video:title: Jakob Nielsen - Directing the Dynamics/UX team
video:video.video:description: It's Dynamics day on Channel 9. Here we meet Jakob Nielsen, director of user experience on the Dynamics team. Wait a second. Don't enterprise apps always have ugly user interfaces? We talk about tha&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Don McGowan - Technology law at Microsoft (and the software industry)
video:video.video:description: Oh, oh, it's one of those evil lawyers! *Microsoft has hundreds of lawyers, but one of our favorites is Don McGowan. He is now a lawyer over in the game division but worked in Windows for a long time &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Chris Muench - writing managed 3D app for mobile devices
video:video.video:description: Usually we have Microsoft employees on here, but Mike Hall met a talented MVP, Chris Muench, a Mobile and Embedded MVP. Here he shows how to write a managed Direct3D application for Windows Mobile dev&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Vijay Rajagopalan - SAP converts to Visual Studio 2005
video:video.video:description: Vijay works in the VSIP program that works with companies to help them convert to our latest technologies. Recently he, and the team he works with, was on campus (all the way from Israel) to port SAP &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Craig Jensen - Windows Embedded for Point of Sale
video:video.video:description: Did you know that Windows Embedded operating system runs many of the world's cash registers? Well, Mike Hall takes his camcorder over to meet Craig Jensen, a developer on the Embedded for Point of Sal&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Otto Berkes - Origami's Architect gives first look at Ultramobile PCs
video:video.video:description: Otto Berkes is the architect (now general manager) behind the Ultra-Mobile PC team, code-named Origami. We have a conversation about Origami and the vision behind it. More on what was announced today &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Manuel Clement - Sparkle CTP Released (er, Expression Interactive Designer)
video:video.video:description: Manuel Clement called us over yesterday to see the latest build of Microsoftâ€™s new Expression Interactive Designer (aka Sparkle). He had some interesting news for us. Today Microsoft is releasing a be&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Target Indy Race Team - Inside the technology of a race team (3 videos)
video:video.video:description: Note: To see all three videos, click on the headline. Does your code go 218 m.p.h.? The code on this project goes that fast and faster. In October we traveled to meet the Target Indy Race Team (Chi&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Target Race Team - Driving an Indy car team
video:video.video:description: Note: To see all three videos, click on the headline. Does your code go 218 m.p.h.? The code on this project goes that fast and faster. In October we traveled to meet the Target Indy Race Team (Chi&#8230;

video:video.video:title: In the pits with the Target race team
video:video.video:description: Ever been in the pits with an Indy race team? Well, the Target team invited us along. Here's just some raw shots we took while they were practicing for the Toyota 400. At about 4:30 in the video you'l&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Robert Fripp - Behind the scenes at Windows Vista recording session
video:video.video:description: Robert Fripp was on the Microsoft campus a few weeks back. He's the famous guitarist and composer, known for his founding role in the band King Crimson. Charles Torre (a big King Crimson fan) was &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Ryan Donovan (and team) - What is Commerce Server?
video:video.video:description: Why use Commerce Server? Lots of big-name retailers do. But, what the heck is it? Now that the Christmas Shopping season is over we sit down with the team that builds the product that runs a lot of &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Cleartype Team - Typography in Windows Vista
video:video.video:description: We always enjoy meeting with Bill Hill, so we thought we'd drop in on him with our camcorder and talk with the ClearType team again and see what's the latest with the fonts in Windows Vista.Those Japa&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Michael Kaplan - Bringing Windows Vista to International markets
video:video.video:description: Bringing Windows Vista to non-English markets is a lot harder than just changing a text file. Here Michael Kaplan, technical lead on the US-Windows Globalization team, on the discusses some of the&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Calvin Rowland - Tour at F5 Networks
video:video.video:description: Now that Microsoft is investing a lot in Internet-based services we thought we'd go and visit a datacenter infrastructure company. So, off to F5 Networks, Inc. we went. After all, if your services do&#8230;

video:video.video:title: James Conard - Touring the Windows Workflow Foundation Team Offices
video:video.video:description: James Conard takes us on a tour of the Windows Workflow Foundation Offices. Something a bit different for Thanksgiving. Here we have a tour of the Workflow Foundation team. Don't know what Windows Wor&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Arash Ghanaie-Sichanie and team - Microsoft CRM 3 preview
video:video.video:description: Yet another reminder that Microsoft doesn't just build Windows and Office. Here we take our camcorder over and meet the team that's building Microsoft's Customer Relationship Management software an&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Chris St.Amand and Jeff Stucky - Debugging Microsoft.com
video:video.video:description: Chris and Jeff debug one of the largest Web sites in the world: microsoft.com. Millions of pages. More traffic than Slashdot.org. A huge data farm. We have an interesting conversation about how they d&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Dave Luebbert - The mentor from early days on Word for Mac team
video:video.video:description: You might not know Dave Luebbert. He doesn't work at Microsoft anymore. He used to work on the Microsoft Word team (he was on the original Mac team).He was Dean Hachomovitch's mentor. Dean is the gu&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Carolyn Napier and Tyler Robinson (MSI team) - Installing apps in Windows Vista
video:video.video:description: Windows Vista evangelist Ernie Booth came into my office a few weeks back and said &quot;hey, let's go interview the MSI 4.0 team.&quot; Who's that? That's the team that makes the application install &#8230;

video:video.video:title: Robert Rebholz (and team) - The Working Network
video:video.video:description: Are you into social bookmarking? OPML? RSS feeds? We go over and meet with the team that's doing The Working Network.com. You get a look at a few of their first projects, including the Community Ba&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Jay Schmelzer - Working on the VB Core Team
video:video.video:description: Ken Levy took his camcorder over to see Jay Schmelzer, lead program manager on the Visual Basic.net team. They have a nice chat about what the VB team has been up to lately.

video:video.video:title: Mat Noguchi - Developer on Halo team gives tour of Bungie
video:video.video:description: Mat Noguchi is a developer at Bungie. Don't know who they are? That's the Microsoft group that developed Halo 2. Halo 2!We get the first tour of Bungie's new offices. He talks about what it's like to&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Larry Hryb - First look at Xbox 360 (with the MVPs)
video:video.video:description: Last month the MVPs (Most Valuable Professionals) were on campus (they are folks who got noticed for doing a lot to help Microsoft's customers out) and we snuck into their meeting with Larry Hryb, ak&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Larry Hryb - Showing off Xbox.com to the MVPs
video:video.video:description: Xbox.com is getting a major overhaul this week to prepare for the Xbox 360 launch. Here, Larry Hryb, aka &quot;Major Nelson&quot; shows the MVPs the changes. If you're a hard-core Xbox'er you'll wan&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Mark Boulter and Brian Pepin - Sneak peak at Cider (visual designer for Orcas, future version of Vis
video:video.video:description: Mark Boulter, PM and technical lead, and Brian Pepin, development lead, talk to us about Cider, a future version of the visual designer that'll ship in Orcas, future version of Visual Studio.They demo&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Andy Edmonds and Erik Selberg - Frank talk about MSN Search
video:video.video:description: Andy Edmonds, lead program manager, and Erik Selberg are two of the geeks who work on making MSN Search better. They talk about how the engine works, and what they're doing to beat the competition. W&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Sean Alexander (and others) - Windows Vista Sidebar and Gadgets
video:video.video:description: Sidebar lives!But it's even better, here Sean Alexander, David Streams, and special guest Sanaz Ahari of the Start.com team, demonstrate the new sidebar and gadgets that come in Windows Vista. Plus, w&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Sonal Pardeshi - Using VSTS's Source Code Management
video:video.video:description: Sonal takes us into meet John Lawrence, development manager on on the Visual Studio 2005 Team Foundation's Source Code Management team. You get to learn all about software project management and lif&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Eric Richards and Team - First look at InfoPath 12
Jeffrey Snover - More talking about Monad
video:video.video:description: Jeffrey Snover has been on Channel 9 before talking about Monad. That was a popular video so we thought we'd have him back on Channel 9 to give us some more thoughts on Monad. You can read more on t&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Paul Yuknewicz - Working with VB Community
video:video.video:description: Do you use Visual Basic? Well, you should get to know Paul Yuknewicz. He's a program manager on the VB team (he's worked there for more than five years). Talks about his experiences working on the V&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Jeff Henshaw and David Alles - Xbox 360 and Media Center: Living room of the future
video:video.video:description: This is the first of a series of videos we'll have on the Xbox 360 over the next few months.You might think that the Xbox 360 is only a game machine. But, here you'll learn it's a lot more than a game&#8230;

video:video.video:title: David Treadwell - Chatting with one of DevDiv's Vice Presidents
video:video.video:description: We're hours away from releasing to manufacture (our way of saying &quot;ship it to the customers&quot;) Visual Studio 2005. This is a big deal for the developer division. There are tons of people wh&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Eddie Churchill - Biztalk's sexy new XSLT Mapper
video:video.video:description: Who said enterprise apps have to be boring? Check out Biztalk's future XSLT Mapper, which makes use of new information interaction technologies. Here you get to meet two researchers from Microsoft&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Sam Gentile and Ward Cunningham - Recounting early days of Wiki
video:video.video:description: Sam Gentile and Ward Cunningham met up with us at the GotDotNet Code Slam event held recently in Microsoft's Visitor Center.You might know Ward Cunningham. He invented the Wiki. Sam was one of the&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Kyle Groves and Dave Goulet: eLearning app demonstrates WPF goodness
video:video.video:description: This eLearning video features Kyle Groves and Dave Goulet from LogicBay demoing a prototype they built for 3M. The very cool thing about the app is the browser integration: it is probably the most&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Lisa Feigenbaum - Code Snippets in Visual Studio
video:video.video:description: Ken Levy takes his camcorder over to interview Lisa Feigenbaum and get a look at the new Code Snippets feature in Visual Studio.

video:video.video:title: Mike Murray - What the guy who wrote shrimp and weenies memo is doing now
video:video.video:description: Can you live on $2 a day? More than half the world's population does.Mike Murray used to be Microsoft's vice president in charge of HR (before that he worked at Apple on the original Macintosh team).&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Meet the new Mobile PC Team (new Tablet PC features too!)
video:video.video:description: Meet a large portion of the teams that make the Tablet PC and laptop/notebook features. We have a wide-ranging discussion from how to make battery life better (developers take note!) to new&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Windows Sideshow Team - Auxiliary Displays (new laptop feature coming next year)
video:video.video:description: Next year there will be a new feature available on some laptops and Tablet PCs: auxiliary displays. This lets you do some things on your computer without needing to open up the computer and wait for&#8230;

video:video.video:title: PDC Dev Team -- Plasma Screen Application at PDC
video:video.video:description: If you were at the PDC last month you saw these plasma screens all over the place. They use RSS and the new Windows Presentation Foundation. Follow us along to to the PDC and meet the guys who built&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Gordon Bell - Tour of the Computer History Museum, Part II
video:video.video:description: Today you get to see Gordon Bell's face light up as he shows you the second half of the Computer History Museum. He also takes us in the back where people don't get to visit.Oh, check out the computer&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Gordon Bell - Tour of the Computer History Museum, Part I
video:video.video:description: Gordon Bell. The name is legendary among geeks. Just read his Wikipedia page to see his accomplishments.About 30 years ago he started collecting computers while working at DEC. That little hobby&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The new Outlook Express: Windows Mail demoed
video:video.video:description: As part of our journey around Windows Vista teams, we wondered what was being done to Outlook Express. Well, for Windows Vista it's been renamed to Windows Mail. And that's not all.

video:video.video:title: Tomas Palmer and Tolga Acar - Crypto in Windows Vista
video:video.video:description: How do you keep your secret stuff secret? Cryptography. Tomas Palmer and Tolga Acar sit down with Joe Smith for an interesting interview.

video:video.video:title: Raymond Chen - PDC 05 Talk: Five Things Every Win32 Programmer Needs to Know
video:video.video:description: We did a hand recording of Raymond Chen's presentation yesterday at the PDC. Sorry for the shaky cam, we didn't have our tripod, but we had a few requests from Channel 9'ers to record this (it'll be&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Paul Vick and Erik Meijer - Dynamic Programming in Visual Basic
video:video.video:description: Paul and Erik talk about what they presented this week at the PDC: Dynamic Programming in Visual Basic.

video:video.video:title: Paul Vick and Amanda Silver - VB Language Futures
video:video.video:description: Here Paul and Amanda talk about the future of Visual Basic.

video:video.video:title: Rob Franco and team - IE 7 Security
video:video.video:description: There's a ton of new things in Internet Explorer 7.0 that'll improve your security. Meet the IE team and learn what they are doing to protect computer users against phishing and malware and other&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Abolade Gbadegesin and team - Networking in Windows Vista
video:video.video:description: The networking stack in Windows Vista has been completely rewritten. Hear about what's new. IPv6. Much better performance. Better firewall. Better security. Exciting stuff! Meet the team too.Also seen&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Steve Ball - Learning about Audio in Windows Vista
video:video.video:description: This is Larry Osterman's long-kept secret. The audio stack in Windows Vista has been completely rewritten so we can have cool things like per-app audio control. Anyway, Steve Ball talks to us about&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Jeff Meng, Paul Sliwowicz, Gerald Maffeo - IO Cancellation
video:video.video:description: Ernie Booth took a camcorder over to meet the IO Cancellation team. What's that? They are working to make thread cancellation in Windows Vista better. Important for developers who work with Windows at&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Shawn Van Ness - Inking with WPF
video:video.video:description: We have a short conversation with Shawn Van Ness of the Tablet PC team and he talks with us about using ink with the Windows Presentation Foundation (formerly Avalon).

video:video.video:title: North Face Demo at the PDC
video:video.video:description: This is one of the coolest applications we've seen at the PDC. Here's a video of the North Face demo that was shown off during Jim Allchin's keynote at the PDC. This demo rocks and it was all done in&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Manuel Clement and others - Introducing Sparkle
video:video.video:description: Microsoft, today, at the PDC, announced Microsoft Expression, which is a suite of three applications to help you build Web sites and new kinds of Windows applications.Here we meet the Expression&#8230;

video:video.video:title: PJ Hough and others - First look at next version of Sharepoint
video:video.video:description: We go into Mike Morton's office and have a chat about the next version of Sharepoint with PJ Hough, group program manager on Sharepoint Services Team. The team talks about the future of Sharepoint&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Eddie Churchill - First look at Solution Designer
video:video.video:description: Meet the Biztalk Solution Designer team. Eddie definitely has the most colorful shirt we've seen on Channel 9 so far.

video:video.video:title: Scott Woodgate and team - Announcing Windows Workflow Foundation
video:video.video:description: This morning at the PDC Microsoft announced Windows Workflow Foundation. Here Scott Woodgate and team (Abhay Parasnis and Paul Andrew) demonstrate the power of the new Workflow Foundation. It's all&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Rob Lefferts - Sharepoint Services and Workflow
video:video.video:description: This morning at the PDC Microsoft announced several workflow initiatives. Rob Lefferts talks about how the Office system is helping information workers do their jobs easier. He talks about Windows&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Julie Larson-Green - Diving into the new Office 12
video:video.video:description: At the PDC this morning Microsoft demonstrated Office 12 in public for the first time. The news you'll hear is &quot;they changed the user interface.&quot; So, we wanted to talk with the team who came&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Shell Team - Exploring and Using Windows Vista
video:video.video:description: At the PDC this morning Microsoft demonstrated the latest version of Windows Vista. Here you get to meet the Shell team. Now, what does the Shell team do? They make the Explorer and do a variety of&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Chris Jones - 10 things devs need to know to build a great Windows Vista application
video:video.video:description: Chris Jones, corporate vice president on the Windows team, sits down with Jeremy Mazner to talk about what developers need to do to make a great Windows Vista application. Video length: 45:02.

video:video.video:title: Kam Vedbrat - Looking at Windows Vista's user interface (AERO)
video:video.video:description: Kam Vedbrat is a lead program manager on the AERO team which redesigned the User Interface of Windows Vista (the next version of Windows). We spend half an hour looking at the user interface.

video:video.video:title: Adam Nathan - Light up an app with WPF (formerly Avalon)
video:video.video:description: Adam Nathan is giving a talk at the PDC on Thursday about making an application &quot;light up&quot; on Windows Vista. To prepare for the talk he created WinFXHearts.com. Very cool version of the&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Anders Hejlsberg - LINQ
video:video.video:description: LINQ stands for Language INtegrated Query and in a nutshell, it makes query and set operations, like SQL statements first class citizens in .NET languages like C# and VB. Here we visit Anders&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Dr. Neil Roodyn - Fooling around in Scoble's office
video:video.video:description: Dr. Neil does the Via Virtual Earth site, among other projects for Microsoft (he also does work for the Tablet PC team). He's a consultant. He was on campus a few days ago and I invited him over to&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Alain Lissoir - Managing Windows with WMI
video:video.video:description: Alain and his team invited me over to talk about managing Windows with WMI. Windows Management Instrumentation. Sounds boring, right? But it makes Windows manageable. Ever want to do something on&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Anil Dhawan - Partying with Bluetooth
video:video.video:description: Mike Hall takes his camcorder over to talk to Anil about his media box that is controlled by his Bluetooth phone. Lots of fun, he built this for his house so he could party with his friends.

video:video.video:title: Mark Law - Virtual Earth Hacks
video:video.video:description: Are you a map hacker? Well, recently we invited some of the best map hackers onto campus to show us how it's done. Think you could do an even better hack? Then enter the Virtual Earth competition&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Mike Downen - .NET CLR Security Team tour
video:video.video:description: Meet the team that's building security into .NET. This is a video that every developer should watch. In the last third of the video the team gives demos of how to build secure apps.

video:video.video:title: Harry Pierson - Software Factories
video:video.video:description: Harry Pierson is an architect at Microsoft. We have a wide-ranging talk about Software Factories, among other trends in software architecture. Harry is well known among architecture circles and&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Doug Neumann - Source Code control guy on VSTS team
video:video.video:description: Doug Neumann is a program manager on Visual Studio Team System's Source Code control system. Join Beth Goza (on camera) and Technical Evangelist Grace Francisco as they talk about Visual Studio Team&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Bill Gates - A short chat with Microsoft's Chief Software Architect
video:video.video:description: Bill Gates. Do we need to say anything more?Visit Bill in his office for a few minutes to talk about where he sees the future going. This is a fun interview, prepares you for the PDC that's coming&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Marc McDonald - Microsoft's First Employee
video:video.video:description: Marc McDonald is Microsoft's first employee. Hired back in 1976. We recently caught up with him and talk about the old days at Microsoft as well as what he's doing on the Windows Vista team (he's&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Tour of the Cambridge Research Lab
video:video.video:description: When we went over to London for vacation this summer we took our camcorders and got a tour of Microsoft's research center in Cambridge, England.Here's who you'll see:Mitch Goldberg, Senior Programme&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Ian Dixon (and others) - Microsoft Home in London, UK
video:video.video:description: Ian Dixon starts this one off. He's not a Microsoft employee but has a great podcast that talks about the Windows Media Center. We met up with him at the Microsoft Home in London. That's a showcase&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Austin Donnelly - Touring around Cambridge England
video:video.video:description: Since Summer is over now and kids are going back to school, thought it would be fun to do one of those &quot;what I did over summer vacation&quot; videos.Here, catch Austin Donnelly taking us around&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Scott Guthrie - BetaDays Demo of ASP.NET 2005
video:video.video:description: Lorin Thwaits filmed Scott Guthrie with his camcorder on May 19 in Scottsdale, Arizona at an event which was called &quot;BetaDays&quot;. Scott was the keynote speaker, and did a tremendous job, Lorin&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Jeff Barr - Scoble goes to Amazon and Learns All About Web Services
video:video.video:description: The latest rage in Web site development is to &quot;remix&quot; or &quot;mashup&quot; services from a variety of different companies. Amazon's Jeff Barr invited us over to see how developers are usi&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Jason Shellen - Scoble visits Google? Blogger for Microsoft Word
video:video.video:description: Microsoft goes to Google? Yeah, Jason Shellen, of Google's Blogger team, invited us over to meet the Google Blogger team where they showed off a new feature that lets you edit your blogs from&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Bill Staples - An hour discovering IIS 7
video:video.video:description: Bill Staples is the group program manager on the IIS 7 team. That's Microsoft's Web Server. We spend an hour discovering IIS 7 (the next version of IIS 7). Includes lots of demos.

video:video.video:title: Brent Hill and Roger Grimes - Chatting about IIS 7's security
video:video.video:description: Roger Grimes is a security expert and author (he wrote a free ebook: Keeping Your Business Safe From Attack: Passwords and Permissions and more than 100 magazine articles on security). Anyway, he&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Sanjay Parthasarathy and Ben Riga - Healthcare demo of Windows Presentation Foundation (AKA Avalon)
video:video.video:description: Cool demo of the Windows Presentation Foundation that Ben Riga gave to a user group recently.

video:video.video:title: Steven Woodward - PDC Handson Labs
video:video.video:description: Are you coming to the PDC? Steven Woodward is working on the hands-on labs and gives you an update about what to expect and how to get the most out of the labs.

video:video.video:title: Mike Burrows - PIX, graphics performance analysis
video:video.video:description: Are you a DirectX game developer? Well, you might check out PIX, which stands for Performance Investigator for DirectX. Mike Burrows demonstrates the tool and how you'd use it on Windows games to&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Jeffrey Richter - Working with Microsoft technologies
video:video.video:description: Jeffrey Richter is a co-founder of Wintellect, and is a consultant with a variety of Microsoft's .NET teams.He's also a popular speaker and trains many people on .NET. Charles Torre sat down with him&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Iain McDonald - Talking about release candidate of Windows Server 2003 R2 (and other stuff)
video:video.video:description: Iain is one of Microsoft's more colorful and controversial personalities. Here we sit down to talk about a variety of things from why to use Server 2003 R2 instead of Linux to what makes a good&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Shishir Mehrotra - WinFS beta 1 team meeting
video:video.video:description: Last week Shishir invited us over to have a chat with the WinFS team. Imagine our suprise when Quentin Clark, director of program management on the WinFS team, started the interview by handing&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Channel 9 Team - Welcome to our new design
video:video.video:description: We visit the worldwide headquarters for Channel 9 (otherwise known as Jeff's office) to talk about the Channel 9 redesign. You meet the geeks behind the technology that brings you Channel 9 (new team&#8230;

video:video.video:title: CLR Team Tour, Part I - Preparing for the PDC
video:video.video:description: Joe Duffy, program manager on the .NET CLR team (that's the technology at the heart of .NET apps) and he takes us on a tour of the CLR team. You meet some of the smartest people at Microsoft (and most&#8230;

video:video.video:title: CLR Team Tour, Part II - The Future of Languages (PDC panel preview)
video:video.video:description: With this second segment of our CLR Team pre-PDC tour we start out with Rico Mariani where we talk again about .NET performance and how to wring the most out of your .NET code.Then we head off to meet&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Arik Cohen - Talking about Windows Presentation Foundation (aka Avalon)
video:video.video:description: Arik Cohen, lead program manager on the Windows Presentation Foundation (formerly known as Avalon) is one of the guys who'll be demonstrating the WPF stuff at the PDC next month. Here's a rare time&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Brad Abrams - CLR'ing his way around the PDC
video:video.video:description: Brad Abrams is a lead program manager on the .NET Common Language Runtime team. You've seen him on Channel 9 before. The PDC is sold out, but tons of you will be there and Brad shares what excites him&#8230;

video:video.video:title: David Smith (and others) - Meeting the Interns
video:video.video:description: Ever wonder what it'd be like to intern at Microsoft? Think that interning at Microsoft might be boring? No, we don't give our interns menial jobs that no one wants to do (many of our best features&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Faris Sweiss - Testing of ASP.NET
video:video.video:description: Faris Sweiss is an SDET lead on the Web Platform and Tools team. The folks who bring you ASP.NET. At about 31:00 he takes us on a tour of the ASP.NET testing and meet the folks who are making sure&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Emily Rimas - Tablet PC Education Pack revealed
video:video.video:description: Microsoft recently released the Microsoft Education Pack for Tablet PC. What is it? It's a free group of applications for students. Just in time for school to start.Cool video to watch just to see&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Rusty Deschenes - Developing on the VS Core Team
video:video.video:description: Mike Sampson took his camcorder over to software design engineer -- he works on Visual Studio core -- Rusty Deschenes' office. Got a demo at about 8:40. Audio is a bit low. Sorry about that.They talk&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Michael Rys - XML in SQL Server
video:video.video:description: Michael Rys, a program manager on SQL Server's engine team, talks with us all about XML in the upcoming SQL Server 2005.He gives us some demos about 27:22 into the video.

video:video.video:title: Bill Crounse - Talking hospital tech with CIO of Overlake Hospital
Steve Lacey - 10 years of Direct X
video:video.video:description: Our game expert, Dave Weller, was also at the recent Microsoft Meltdown conference, and sat down with Steve Lacey, developer on Flight Simulator.The two of them talked about how far DirectX graphic&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Brian Benincasa - Talking Graphics Technologies at Meltdown Conference
video:video.video:description: Our new videographer, Beth Goza, attended the Microsoft Meltdown conference recently (it's a conference aimed at game developers) and interviewed Brian Benincasa, lead evangelist on the gaming and&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Jerry Dunietz - XML Paper Specification
video:video.video:description: XPS (formerly code-named &quot;Metro&quot;) is a new XML-based file format that we think you'll find interesting -- it's a great way to build a file that's easily interoperable with other applications&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Ford Davidson - The latest in cell phones
video:video.video:description: Cell phones are starting to become really powerful computing devices. They are getting high res cameras, GPS's, better screens, more APIs, and even hard drives. To find out what's the latest we&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Rob Barker - Why Rob cares about SmartClients?
video:video.video:description: Why does Rob Barker care about SmartClients? Listen in and hear why.He has a demo of a cool Web site that he turns into a SmartClient at about 13:30. Translation, unless you're a geek skip ahead to&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Eric Horvitz - Managing your email better with Outlook Mobile Manager
video:video.video:description: On the Channel 9 team we get a ton of email. It's overwhelming at times, actually. So, we were very interested when Eric Horvitz (Microsoft's most prolific inventor) said &quot;I have something that&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Sanaz Ahari and Steve Rider - Start.com
video:video.video:description: After shooting this interview with Sanaz Ahari and Steve Rider I wrote a fun blog post titled: Hadi Partovi, what are you thinking?That's cause this small team (now three people) is doing an&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Bill Reid - Introducing the Shared Computer Toolkit
video:video.video:description: Got a shared computer? You know, one that sits in a library, a school, a store, or a lobby where lots of people will share one computer?Well, the Shared Computer Toolkit makes it really easy to&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Eric Deily - IIS 7 preview
video:video.video:description: Eric Deily, program manager on the IIS 7 team, talks about some of the things that excite him about IIS 7. IIS (Internet Information Services) is Microsoft's Web server. He says&#8230;

video:video.video:title: David Anderson - Writing Agile Software
video:video.video:description: David Anderson writes the Agile Management blog that's been getting quote popular (and wrote a book on the same topic). He's been working with teams inside Microsoft to get them to ship software&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Steve Cellini - Meet the PDC Planning Team
Steve Winfield - Building Systems
video:video.video:description: Steve Winfield heads the US System Builder team and is a lot of fun. Check out &quot;Black Comb&quot; and &quot;Longhorn&quot; in his office and meet Victor Mux. We sit down for a short chat about the&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Robert Scoble - Walk to Ballmer's office
video:video.video:description: Jeff recorded Robert getting ready for the Steve Ballmer interview. Just something fun for your Friday afternoon. Dang, I have to clean up my office. You get to see the video equipment we use here on&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Mike Swanson - Adobe Illustrator to XAML converter
video:video.video:description: Mike Swanson wanted to use XAML and the new Avalon, but was having trouble getting his Adobe Illustrator files ported over so he wrote his own converter.This thing is awesome for graphic designers who&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Steve Ballmer - Quick chat with Microsoft's CEO
video:video.video:description: We just had a short chat with Steve Ballmer in his office (we filmed the interview today, July 7, at 1:30 p.m.)Questions?Why does Microsoft care about developers?01:11 Why does Microsoft have an&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Kim Cameron - Identity Laws
Owen Braun and Chris Pratley - Talking about OneNote
Virtual Earth: MSN's answer to Google Maps
video:video.video:description: I spent some time today interviewing the Virtual Earth team. This is MSN's answer to Google Maps, coming in July 2005. As you see in the video MSN Virtual Earth goes noticeably further than Google&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Jim Allchin - From starving musician to Longhorn vice president
video:video.video:description: Yesterday morning we sat down with Vice President Jim Allchin (aka the guy who is responsible for developing Windows).Here's an index of the questions we ask. We talk about Longhorn and the recent&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Rick Laplante - Talking about Visual Studio Team System, Part I
Anil Dhawan - Look at Bluetooth programming on Windows Mobile
video:video.video:description: Anil Dhawan, a Program Manager in the Windows Mobile group, provides a look at Bluetooth programming on Windows Mobile devices and shows remote control of PowerPoint from a Smartphone using Bluetooth.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Larry Osterman - What's the secret to succeeding at one company for 20 years?
video:video.video:description: How do you succeed as a software developer for 20 years? Especially one working at a single company like Microsoft?He tells an interesting story about when his boss yelled at him for trying to pass&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Joe Stegman - Reacts to &quot;Web is taking it all&quot; statement
video:video.video:description: How would you react to this statement: &quot;the Web is taking over all development?&quot;That's what we asked Joe, program manager on the Windows Forms team.How would you answer that? Do you believe&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Joe Stegman - Why can't we move all APIs into the browser?
video:video.video:description: We wondered why all apps couldn't be done in the Web browser. Joe, a program manager on the Windows Forms team, tells why the browser can't do it all.

video:video.video:title: Joe Stegman - What can't you do with WinForms?
video:video.video:description: You've heard the hype about what Winforms can do, but what about what WinForms isn't good at? Joe Stegman answers that.

video:video.video:title: Sara Williams - Demo of new MSDN Product Feedback Center
video:video.video:description: One of the questions we often get is &quot;how can I know whether or not Microsoft is listening to my Visual Studio 2005 bug reports?&quot;Thanks to MSDN's new Product Feedback Center you can&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Christopher Brumme - The nirvana of easy, reliable programming
video:video.video:description: Christopher Brumme, architect on the .NET Common Language Runtime team, gives his view of what nirvana for a programmer should be. This post is sorta like Chris' blog. Lots of words and if you&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Tetsuo Seto - Demonstrates Tablet PC multilanguage features
video:video.video:description: Tetsuo Seto, Tablet PC team's East Asian program manager, demonstrates the new Windows XP Tablet PC Edition 2005's ability to recognize handwriting done in multiple languages.We've also filmed this de&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Tetsuo Seto - Demonstrates Tablet PC multilanguage features (in Japanese)
video:video.video:description: Tetsuo Seto demonstrates the new Windows XP Tablet PC Edition 2005's ability to recognize handwriting done in multiple languages.This video is in Japanese.

video:video.video:title: Mike Hall - Build a new Windows CE operating system in less than 10 minutes
video:video.video:description: Mike Hall builds and debugs a Windows CE operating system for a new device right in front of you. All in less than 10 minutes.

video:video.video:title: Bill Hill - Do you think anyone is going to read a book on the screen?
video:video.video:description:
Bill Hill talks about the difficulties in making the reading experience on the screen good enough so that people will read entire books on the screen. (He claims that
ClearType got people&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Dare Obasanjo - What is the best place to learn about XML?
video:video.video:description: Dare, who is a program manager on the XML team, recommends visiting MSDN's XML Dev Center to learn more about XML. How about you? What are the best places to learn about XML (and subsets like RSS)? &#8230;
